article.words:
One evening as Marie Mallard
was bobbing for a dinner of
tasty water plants in Peterson
Pone, she heard her parents say
a word that she didn't
understand. They said that they
were going to be migrating in a
few days.

The next day, she asked her best
friend, a frog named Robert, if
he knew what migrating meant.

Robert puffed his throat
thoughtfully. "I think that when
animals migrate, they move to a
new place. Sometimes they
move somewhere when it gets
cold so that they can find more
food to eat."

"Last night, my parents said that
we would be migrating," Marie
said.

Robert's eyes widened. "You are
going to be leaving Peterson
Pond? Oh, no!" He ducked his
head under the water like he
often did when he was sad.
Marie could barely see him,
which made her think of
something.

"Wait a second," she quacked.
"If my family can't find me, they
can't leave."

Robert's eyes lit up. "That's a
great idea. Can you hide
underwater like me?"

"I'll give it a try," she said. She
put her head under the water,
but her tail stuck straight up into
the air.

"I don't think that's going to
work," Robert said with a
croaking laugh.

They found some other places to
hide, but when it was time for
dinner, Marie's dad found them
without any trouble.

"What are you two doing hiding
in those bushes?" he asked.

Marie sighed and waddled out
of the bushes. "We were trying
to hide so I wouldn't have to
leave home. I guess it didn't
work very well."

Her dad wrapped a kind wing
around her. "I understand how
hard this is. But Marie, we're not
going to be leaving forever.
We'll go south until winter is over,
but return when the weather's
warm again. You'll see each
other again before you know it."

That made Marie feel a little bit
better. That night, she let herself
imagine her new homeâ€”a
warm place full of food and
maybe even some new friends.

To Marie, Peterson Pone was still
the best place in the whole
world. But as she fell asleep, she
hoped that her new home might
just be the second-best place.

questions.words:
Who are the *two* main
characters in this passage?

What is the main problem in
this passage?

options.words:
Marie's dad can't find Marie
and Robert

Marie can't get her whole
body under water

Robert is jealous because he
wants to migrate

Marie doesn't want to leave
the pond

questions.words:
Arrange the events from the
passage in the order in which
they happen. Click the
sentences to drag them into
the correct locations.

options.words:
Marie imagined what her
new home would be like.

Marie heard her parents say
they would be migrating.

Marie and Robert hid in the
bushes.

Marie's dad explained that
they would be coming back
to Peterson Pond.
